data.title: Many People Don’t Know Ernest Hemingway Made This Small Town In Idaho His Home
data.meta_description: Did you know the famous American novelist Ernest Hemingway made his home and was buried in a small town in Idaho?
data.text:
If you paid attention during high school English class, you’ve likely heard of Ernest Hemingway and have read some of his works. This American novelist is well-known for his novels like “For Whom the Bell Tolls” and “The Old Man and the Sea.” He even won the Pulitzer Prize in 1953 and the Nobel Prize in 1954. However, what many Idahoans don’t know is that this famous writer made a small town in Idaho his home.

Advertisement

Ernest Hemingway left quite the history in a small town in Idaho. Do you know of any other famous individuals who made Idaho their home? What are some of your favorite things to do in Sun Valley, ID? Did you know that Ernest Hemingway lived in Sun Valley? Let us know in the comments!

More to Explore

Things to do in Sun Valley, Idaho

What are some things to do in Sun Valley, Idaho?

Sun Valley, Idaho is the ultimate getaway destination in Idaho. While the ski resort is one of the big draws to this area, it isn’t the only thing you will want to add to your itinerary. A few additional things to do in Sun Valley, Idaho include:

Plan a visit to the small town of Ketchum. This town lies just outside of Sun Valley and is a foodie’s paradise.

Spend the day fly fishing.

Go hiking. Especially during the summer months, there are incredible hikes to help you explore this area.

Go ice skating. The outdoor ice skating rink at Sun Valley Resort is magnificent any time of the year.

What are some other small towns in Idaho to visit?

Sun Valley certainly deserves a spot on every bucket list but there are many other small towns in Idaho that deserve your attention. A few of our favorite small towns in Idaho include:

Rigby

Almo

Ketchum

Island Park

Stanley

Ririe

McCall

Where are some other destinations in Idaho that I don’t want to miss?

Yes, there are small towns in Idaho that are bucket list worthy and Sun Valley is one area that every Idahoan should visit at least once, but there is so much more to the Gem State that is worth exploring. A few additional bucket-list-worthy destinations in Idaho include:

Three Island Crossing State Park, Glenns Ferry

Lake Walcott State Park, Rupert

Land of Yankee Fork State Park, Challis

The Palouse in northern Idaho

Lava Hot Springs, Lava Hot Springs

Upper Mesa Falls, near Ashton
